intro: Sarcolaena multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered coral tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant features showy, red or orange-red flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling coral in appearance. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Sarcolaena multiflora is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-resistant species.
